1.text: To all a season, and a time to every inclination under the heavens:

2.text: A time to be born, and a time to die; a time to plant, and a time to pluck up the planting.

3.text: A time to kill, and a time to heal; a time to break down, and a time to build:

4.text: A time to weep, and a time to laugh; a time to mourn, and a time to dance:

5.text: A time to cast away stones, and a time to collect stones a time to embrace, and a time to be far from embracing:

6.text: A time to seek, and a time to lose; a time to watch, and a time to cast away.

7.text: A time to rend, and a time to sew; a time to be silent, and a time to speak:

8.text: A time to love, and a time to hate; a time of war, and a time of peace:

9.text: What the excellence of him working in what he labored?

10.text: I saw the labor which God gave to the sons of man to be humbled in it.

11.text: He made everything beautiful in his time: also he gave hidden time in their heart, so that man shall not find the work which God did from the beginning and even to the end.

12.text: I knew that no good is in them, but to rejoice and to do good in his life.

13.text: And also every man shall eat and drink, and see the good in all his labor; it is the gift of God.

14.text: I knew that all which God will do it shall be forever: to it not to be added, and from it not to be taken away: and God doing they shall be afraid from his face.

15.text: What was, it is already; and what to be, was already; and God will seek him being driven away.

16.text: And yet I saw under the sun the place of judgment, there the unjust one; and the place of the just one, there the unjust one.

17.text: I said in my heart, The just one and the unjust one, God will judge: for a time for every inclination and for every work there.

18.text: I said in my heart concerning the speeches of the sons of man, for God to separate them, and for them to see that they are cattle to themselves.

19.text: For the event of the sons of man, and the event of the cattle, one event to them: as this, so dies this; and the breath of one to all; and the preeminence of man not above the cattle: for all is vanity.

20.text: All go to one place; all were from dust, and all turned back to dust.

21.text: Who shall know the spirit of the sons of man? it ascending to above, and the spirit of cattle, it going downwards to the earth.

22.text: And I saw that no good more than that man shall rejoice in his works; for this is his portion: for who shall bring him to look upon what shall be after him?
